name: Paneer Tikka Masala
directions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, tikka masala spice blend, and salt to create a marinade.
Add paneer and bell peppers to the marinade. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour.
Thread marinated paneer and bell peppers onto skewers.
Heat oil in a pan and grill the skewers until paneer is golden brown.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: Handful of mint and coriander leaves
directions: In a pan, heat ghee and sauté sliced onions until golden brown. Set aside half for garnish.
Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and biryani spice mix. Let it marinate for 2 hours.
In a large pot, layer marinated chicken, soaked basmati rice, mint, coriander, and sautéed onions.
Repeat the layers and drizzle ghee on top.
Cover and cook on low heat until rice is cooked and chicken is tender.

name: Masoor Dal Tadka
directions: Boil masoor dal in a pot until soft. Set aside.
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and chopped onions. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked dal to the tomato mixture. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or bread.

name: Aloo Gobi
directions: In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets. Mix well and cover. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

name: Palak Paneer
directions: Blanch chopped spinach in hot water and blend into a smooth puree.
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add paneer cubes and spinach puree. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with cream and serve with naan or rice.

name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: Handful of mint and coriander leaves
directions: In a pan, heat ghee and sauté sliced onions until golden brown. Set aside half for garnish.
Mix mixed vegetables with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and biryani spice mix. Let it marinate for 1 hour.
In a large pot, layer marinated vegetables, soaked basmati rice, mint, coriander, and sautéed onions.
Repeat the layers and drizzle ghee on top.
Cover and cook on low heat until rice is cooked and vegetables are tender.

name: Dal Makhani
directions: Boil soaked black lentils and kidney beans in a pressure cooker until soft. Set aside.
In a pan, heat butter and add cumin seeds. Sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and pureed tomatoes. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Add boiled lentils and kidney beans, garam masala, and salt. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Stir in cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Vegetable Korma
directions: In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, and turmeric powder. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until they are half-cooked.
In a blender, grind grated coconut with yogurt to form a smooth paste.
Add the coconut-yogurt paste to the vegetables and simmer until vegetables are tender.
Garnish with cashews and serve hot.

name: Chicken Curry
directions: In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add pureed tomatoes and cook until the mixture thickens.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they are well-coated with the masala.
Cover and simmer until the chicken is cooked through. Serve hot.

name: Egg Masala
directions: In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and turmeric powder. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Cut boiled eggs into halves and add them to the masala. Coat the eggs with the masala.
Garnish with garam masala and coriander leaves. Serve hot.
